enum.name: enum
enum.description: Enum constructor allows matching for a set of predefined strings and converts them into respectively assigned integer values. The strings and respective integer values are declared as series of key-value pairs, separated by commas and enclosed in curly brackets.

cis.name: cis
cis.description: Allows matching string values case insensitively. Default false.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

json.name: json
json.description: Parses Json objects (structure of name-value pairs enclosed in curly brackets) according to RFC 8259

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

greedy.name: greedy
greedy.description: string representing name for variant_object capturing unspecified members.

flat.name: flat
flat.description: "true" causes explicitly specified members exported as resultset columns (as opposed to tuple fields).

maxlen.name: maxlen
maxlen.description: numeric value representing the maximum byte size of a JSON object. Allows parsing large JSON objects (exceeding default size of 128000 bytes)

strict.name: strict
strict.description: "false" allows parsing objects not following JSON specification. Unquoted JSON names and string values consisting of one word can be parsed

json_array.name: json_array
json_array.description: JSON syntax allows constructing arrays in a variety of ways. They can range from very simple primitive type members to very complex nested object members. A JSON array can contain members of a different type. And it is perfectly valid that they can appear also outside of a JSON object. JSON_ARRAY is meant to handle all of them.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

typed.name: typed
typed.description: Boolean value, allowing to control JSON_ARRAY output type: "true" sets the output type to ARRAY, "false" sets output type to VARIANT_ARRAY

strict.name: strict
strict.description: Boolean value. "false" allows parsing arrays not following JSON specification. Unquoted JSON names and string values consisting of one word can be parsed. Default is "true". See parsing_json_nstrict.

maxlen.name: maxlen
maxlen.description: numeric value representing the maximum byte size of a JSON object. Allows parsing large JSON objects (exceeding default size of 128000 bytes)

json_value.name: json_value
json_value.description: Parses JSON elements like an array, string, number, boolean, null which are not enclosed in a JSON object. This is perfectly valid and allowed by JSON Grammar.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

typed.name: typed
typed.description: Boolean value, allowing to control JSON_VALUE output type: "false" sets the output to variant type, "true" sets output directly to explicitly selected conversion type. Effective only when used with the explicit conversion.

strict.name: strict
strict.description: Boolean value. "false" allows parsing arrays not following JSON specification. Unquoted JSON names and string values consisting of one word can be parsed. Default is "true". See parsing_json_nstrict.

maxlen.name: maxlen
maxlen.description: numeric value representing the maximum byte size of a JSON object. Allows parsing large JSON objects (exceeding default size of 128000 bytes)

kvp.name: kvp
kvp.description: Parses a list of unordered, variable-length key-value pairs according to the supplied pattern.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

array.name: array
array.description: The ARRAY allows parsing repeated sequences of variable number data elements, specified by a pattern supplied as an argument.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

structure.name: structure
structure.description: The STRUCTURE allows capturing any sequence of matchers in tuple data type.

eol.name: eol
eol.description: Matches the single line feed character (ASCII 0xa).

eolwin.name: eolwin
eolwin.description: Matches two characters: line feed followed by the carriage return (ASCII 0xd 0xa)

ld.name: ld
ld.description: Matches any characters until the next non-optional matcher in the scope of a line.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

data.name: data
data.description: Matches any characters until the next non-optional matcher of pattern expression.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

sqs.name: sqs
sqs.description: Matches string enclosed between single quotes (ASCII 0x27). Any single quote inside the string must be escaped by backslash character "".

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

dqs.name: dqs
dqs.description: Matches string enclosed between double-quote characters (ASCII 0x22). Any double quote inside the string must be escaped by a backslash character (ASCII 0x5c).

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

csvsqs.name: csvsqs
csvsqs.description: Matches string enclosed between single quotes (ASCII 0x27). Any single quote inside the string must be escaped by single quote character (CSV style).

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

csvdqs.name: csvdqs
csvdqs.description: Matches string enclosed between double-quote characters (ASCII 0x22). Any double quote inside the string must be escaped by double-quote character (CSV style).

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

boolean.name: boolean
boolean.description: Matches case insensitive strings true and false

float.name: float
float.description: Matches floating point numbers in the form of [+|-]?[0-9]+[.0-9]* (dot "." separated) or [+|-]?[0-9]+[E|e0-9]* (scientific notation)

min.name: min
min.description: The minimum of parsed value. If the value is less then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

max.name: max
max.description: The maximum of parsed value. If the value is greater then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

cfloat.name: cfloat
cfloat.description: Same as FLOAT, but with separator comma "," : [+|-]?[0-9]+[,0-9]* or [+|-]?[0-9]+[E|e0-9]*

min.name: min
min.description: The minimum of parsed value. If the value is less then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

max.name: max
max.description: The maximum of parsed value. If the value is greater then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

double.name: double
double.description: Matches floating point numbers in the form of [+|-]?[0-9]+[.0-9]* (dot "." separated) or [+|-]?[0-9]+[E|e0-9]* (scientific notation)

min.name: min
min.description: The minimum of parsed value. If the value is less then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

max.name: max
max.description: The maximum of parsed value. If the value is greater then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

cdouble.name: cdouble
cdouble.description: Same as DOUBLE, but with separator comma: [+|-]?[0-9]+[,0-9]* or [+|-]?[0-9]+[E|e0-9]*

min.name: min
min.description: The minimum of parsed value. If the value is less then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

max.name: max
max.description: The maximum of parsed value. If the value is greater then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

int.name: int
int.description: Matches integral numbers in the range -2147483648 to 2147483647

min.name: min
min.description: The minimum of parsed value. If the value is less then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

max.name: max
max.description: The maximum of parsed value. If the value is greater then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

hexint.name: hexint
hexint.description: Matches integral numbers in the range -2147483648 to 2147483647

min.name: min
min.description: The minimum of parsed value. If the value is less then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

max.name: max
max.description: The maximum of parsed value. If the value is greater then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

long.name: long
long.description: Matches integral numbers in the range -18446744073709551615 to 18446744073709551614

min.name: min
min.description: The minimum of parsed value. If the value is less then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

max.name: max
max.description: The maximum of parsed value. If the value is greater then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

hexlong.name: hexlong
hexlong.description: Matches integral numbers in the hexadecimal notation: [+|-]?0?x?[0-9a-fA-F]+ with values in the range -18446744073709551615 to 18446744073709551614

min.name: min
min.description: The minimum of parsed value. If the value is less then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

max.name: max
max.description: The maximum of parsed value. If the value is greater then parsing fails and the output is set to NULL.

iso8601.name: iso8601
iso8601.description: Matches timestamp in the form of yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ

httpdate.name: httpdate
httpdate.description: Matches timestamp in the form of dd/MMM/yyyy:HH:mm:ss Z

jsontimestamp.name: jsontimestamp
jsontimestamp.description: Matches timestamp in the form of yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZ

timestamp.name: timestamp
timestamp.description: Matches timestamp in the form of yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZ

format.name: format
format.description: String specifying the conversion pattern enclosed in single or double-quotes.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: String specifying timezone name (as defined in IANA Time Zone Database﻿) enclosed in single quotes. Default value: as specified in the user properties.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

creditcard.name: creditcard
creditcard.description: Matches valid credit card numbers (i.e with valid Luhn checksum) in all varieties: lengths (depending on the credit card scheme), formattings (continuous, space-delimited), encodings (when submitted in the URL).

smartscapeid.name: smartscapeid
smartscapeid.description: The SMARTSCAPEID matches a string representation of a Smartscape ID and creates a Smartscape ID parser.

ipaddr.name: ipaddr
ipaddr.description: Matches IPv4 addresses in dot-decimal notation and IPv6 addresses in hextet notation.

ipv4.name: ipv4
ipv4.description: Matches IPv4 addresses in dot-decimal notation.

ipv6.name: ipv6
ipv6.description: Matches IPv6 addresses in hextet notation.

mos.name: mos
mos.description: Matches any bytes in the middle of string

uuidstring.name: uuidstring
uuidstring.description: Matches valid Universally Unique Identifiers (UUIDs), such as social security numbers. Creates a UUID string parser.

xml.name: xml
xml.description: The XML matcher parses XML documents, creating a structure that adapts to the content of the XML document.

rootTag.name: rootTag
rootTag.description: string specifying the name of the XML element from which to parse content. The first occurrence is selected if multiple such elements exist. By default, the matcher parses the whole XML document

excludeRoot.name: excludeRoot
excludeRoot.description: "true" excludes the root element from the output. The default is false

ignoreNamespace.name: ignoreNamespace
ignoreNamespace.description: Boolean value. "true" removes namespace prefixes in the output. The default is false.

maxlen.name: maxlen
maxlen.description: numeric value representing the maximum byte size of an XML document. Allows parsing large XML documents (exceeding default size of 128000 bytes)

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

xml_plain.name: xml_plain
xml_plain.description: With XML_PLAIN, you get a streamlined version of the XML data. The matcher discards attributes of XML elements. It can be helpful for cases where this information is unnecessary since it reduces the output structure's complexity, making it easier to work with the parsed data.

rootTag.name: rootTag
rootTag.description: string specifying the name of the XML element from which to parse content. The first occurrence is selected if multiple such elements exist. By default, the matcher parses the whole XML document

excludeRoot.name: excludeRoot
excludeRoot.description: "true" excludes the root element from the output. The default is false

ignoreNamespace.name: ignoreNamespace
ignoreNamespace.description: Boolean value. "true" removes namespace prefixes in the output. The default is false.

maxlen.name: maxlen
maxlen.description: numeric value representing the maximum byte size of an XML document. Allows parsing large XML documents (exceeding default size of 128000 bytes)

locale.name: locale
locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

xml_verbose.name: xml_verbose
xml_verbose.description: You receive the most detailed and comprehensive data structure when parsing XML documents using the XML_VERBOSE matcher. In contrast to the XML matcher, the XML_VERBOSE matcher creates an output structure that is fixed and does not depend on the presence of element attributes or child elements.

rootTag.name: rootTag
rootTag.description: string specifying the name of the XML element from which to parse content. The first occurrence is selected if multiple such elements exist. By default, the matcher parses the whole XML document

excludeRoot.name: excludeRoot
excludeRoot.description: "true" excludes the root element from the output. The default is false

ignoreNamespace.name: ignoreNamespace
ignoreNamespace.description: Boolean value. "true" removes namespace prefixes in the output. The default is false.

maxlen.name: maxlen
maxlen.description: numeric value representing the maximum byte size of an XML document. Allows parsing large XML documents (exceeding default size of 128000 bytes)

locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag enclosed in single or double quotes (see the list in https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry). The default locale is English

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

charset.name: charset
charset.description: character set name enclosed in single or double quotes (for example charset="ISO-8859-1")

fs.description: string (enclosed in single or double quotes) or matcher expression (enclosed in curly brackets) representing field separator
